elements.name: vaadin-crud-edit
elements.description:
`<vaadin-crud-edit>` is a helper element for `<vaadin-grid-column>` that provides
an easily themable button that fires an `edit` event with the row item as detail
when clicked.

Typical usage is in a `<vaadin-grid-column>` of a custom `<vaadin-grid>` inside
a `<vaadin-crud>` to enable editing.

attributes.name: ?disabled
attributes.description:
When disabled, the button is rendered as "dimmed" and prevents all
user interactions (mouse and keyboard).

Since disabled buttons are not focusable and cannot react to hover
events by default, it can cause accessibility issues by making them
entirely invisible to assistive technologies, and prevents the use
of Tooltips to explain why the action is not available. This can be
addressed by enabling the feature flag `accessibleDisabledButtons`,
which makes disabled buttons focusable and hoverable, while still
preventing them from being triggered:

```js
// Set before any button is attached to the DOM.
window.Vaadin.featureFlags.accessibleDisabledButtons = true
```

attributes.name: @edit
attributes.description: Fired when user on the icon.

elements.name: vaadin-crud-edit-column
elements.description:
`<vaadin-crud-edit-column>` is a helper element for the `<vaadin-grid>`
that provides a clickable and themable edit icon.

Typical usage is in a custom `<vaadin-grid>` inside a `<vaadin-crud>`.

#### Example:
```html
<vaadin-grid>
 <vaadin-crud-edit-column></vaadin-crud-edit-column>

 <vaadin-grid-column>
   ...
```

attributes.name: ?resizable
attributes.description: When set to true, the column is user-resizable.

attributes.name: ?frozen
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen. When a column inside of a column group is frozen,
all of the sibling columns inside the group will get frozen also.

attributes.name: ?frozenToEnd
attributes.description:
When true, the column is frozen to end of grid.

When a column inside of a column group is frozen to end, all of the sibling columns
inside the group will get frozen to end also.

Column can not be set as `frozen` and `frozenToEnd` at the same time.

attributes.name: ?rowHeader
attributes.description:
When true, the cells for this column will be rendered with the `role` attribute
set as `rowheader`, instead of the `gridcell` role value used by default.

When a column is set as row header, its cells will be announced by screen readers
while navigating to help user identify the current row as uniquely as possible.

attributes.name: ?hidden
attributes.description: When set to true, the cells for this column are hidden.

attributes.name: .header
attributes.description: Text content to display in the header cell of the column.

attributes.name: .textAlign
attributes.description:
Aligns the columns cell content horizontally.
Supported values: "start", "center" and "end".

attributes.name: .headerPartName
attributes.description: Custom part name for the header cell.

attributes.name: .footerPartName
attributes.description: Custom part name for the footer cell.

attributes.name: .headerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the header content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The header cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .footerRenderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the footer content.
Receives two arguments:

- `root` The footer cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.

attributes.name: .width
attributes.description:
Width of the cells for this column.

Please note that using the `em` length unit is discouraged as
it might lead to misalignment issues if the header, body, and footer
cells have different font sizes. Instead, use `rem` if you need
a length unit relative to the font size.

attributes.name: .renderer
attributes.description:
Custom function for rendering the cell content.
Receives three arguments:

- `root` The cell content DOM element. Append your content to it.
- `column` The `<vaadin-grid-column>` element.
- `model` The object with the properties related with
  the rendered item, contains:
  - `model.index` The index of the item.
  - `model.item` The item.
  - `model.expanded` Sublevel toggle state.
  - `model.level` Level of the tree represented with a horizontal offset of the toggle button.
  - `model.selected` Selected state.
  - `model.detailsOpened` Details opened state.
  - `model.hasChildren` Whether the item has children.

attributes.name: .path
attributes.description:
Path to an item sub-property whose value gets displayed in the column body cells.
The property name is also shown in the column header if an explicit header or renderer isn't defined.

attributes.name: .ariaLabel
attributes.description: The arial-label for the edit button

elements.name: vaadin-crud

attributes.name: ?editOnClick
attributes.description:
Enables user to click on row to edit it.
Note: When enabled, auto-generated grid won't show the edit column.

attributes.name: ?noFilter
attributes.description: Disable filtering when grid is autoconfigured.

attributes.name: ?noSort
attributes.description: Disable sorting when grid is autoconfigured.

attributes.name: ?noHead
attributes.description: Remove grid headers when it is autoconfigured.

attributes.name: ?editorOpened
attributes.description: Reflects the opened status of the editor.

attributes.name: ?noToolbar
attributes.description:
Controls visibility state of toolbar.
When set to false toolbar is hidden and shown when set to true.

attributes.name: .i18n
.items
attributes.description: An array containing the items which will be stamped to the column template instances.

attributes.name: .editedItem
attributes.description: The item being edited in the dialog.

attributes.name: .editorPosition
attributes.description:
Sets how editor will be presented on desktop screen.

Accepted values are:
  - `` (default) - form will open as overlay
  - `bottom` - form will open below the grid
  - `aside` - form will open on the grid side (_right_, if lft and _left_ if rtl)

attributes.name: .dataProvider
attributes.description:
Function that provides items lazily. Receives arguments `params`, `callback`

`params.page` Requested page index
`params.pageSize` Current page size
`params.filters` Currently applied filters
`params.sortOrders` Currently applied sorting orders

`callback(items, size)` Callback function with arguments:
  - `items` Current page of items
  - `size` Total number of items

attributes.name: .include
attributes.description:
A comma-separated list of fields to include in the generated grid and the generated editor.

It can be used to explicitly define the field order.

When it is defined [`exclude`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/25.0.3/#/elements/vaadin-crud#property-exclude) is ignored.

Default is undefined meaning that all properties in the object should be mapped to fields.

attributes.name: .exclude
attributes.description:
A comma-separated list of fields to be excluded from the generated grid and the generated editor.

When [`include`](https://cdn.vaadin.com/vaadin-web-components/25.0.3/#/elements/vaadin-crud#property-include) is defined, this parameter is ignored.

Default is to exclude all private fields (those properties starting with underscore)

attributes.name: @cancel
attributes.description:
Fired when user discards edition. If the default is prevented, then
no action is performed, user is responsible to close dialog and reset
item and grid.

attributes.name: @delete
attributes.description:
Fired when user wants to delete item. If the default is prevented, then
no action is performed, items array is not modified nor dialog closed

attributes.name: @edit
attributes.description:
Fired when user wants to edit an existing item. If the default is prevented, then
a new item is not assigned to the form, giving that responsibility to the app, though
dialog is always opened.

attributes.name: @new
attributes.description: Fired when user wants to create a new item.

attributes.name: @save
attributes.description:
Fired when user wants to save a new or an existing item. If the default is prevented, then
no action is performed, items array is not modified nor dialog closed

attributes.name: @items-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `items` property changes.

attributes.name: @edited-item-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `editedItem` property changes.

attributes.name: @editor-opened-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `editorOpened` property changes.

attributes.name: @size-changed
attributes.description: Fired when the `size` property changes.
